title: "Combining" two fonts into one?
content:
For font families such as Perpetua and Perpetua Expert where the numerals are "old style" in Perpetua Expert but Roman in Perpetua - is it possible to have a single "combined" font containing the lettering of one font and the numerals of the other?

Thanks!
author: drmns

comments.content:
Yes. In fact, Perpetua Standard contains the full character sets of both fonts, with appropriate OpenType layout features to access them.

Cheers,

T

Thanks, Tom.

I'm a newbie - for Perpetua Standard, how would one access the desired numeral style?

Assuming you'd be using InDesign, you just have to select them from the OpenType panel.
